description: Latin significatus, past participle of significare.

entries.meaning: (logic) One of several things signified by a common term.
examples: “Britain is an island;” “all tyrants are miserable; ” “no miser is rich; ” are universal propositions, and their subjects are therefore said to be distrubted. being understood to stand, each, for the whole of its Significates: but, “some islands are fertile;” “all tyrants are not assassinated;" are Particular, and their subjects, consequently, not distributed,  being taken to stand for a part only of their Significates
